decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures and use them to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that provide card advantage, such as Vivien, Champion of the Wilds and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also having removal options like Deputy of Detention. The Bant colors allow for a mix of aggression and control, with a focus on tempo and efficiency. The deck aims to establish an early presence and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a victory.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the game. By using cards like Thought Erasure and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. Removal spells like Kaya's Wrath and Vraska's Contempt help deal with threats on the board, while counterspells like Absorb and Dovin's Veto prevent key spells from resolving. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Chemister's Insight to help maintain a steady stream of resources. The goal is to out-value the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, counter spells, and board wipes. By using cards like Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's hand and draw, along with removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Kaya's Wrath, the deck aims to maintain board control. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria is used for card advantage and board presence, while cards like Chemister's Insight provide card draw to ensure consistency. The deck also includes a win condition in Liliana, Dreadhorde General as a finisher.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, while also maintaining card advantage with draw spells. The win condition is to stabilize the board with board wipes and removal while generating card advantage with Teferi, Time Raveler and Search for Azcanta. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through incremental advantage and planeswalker value. It's a slow, methodical approach to the game that rewards patient and calculated decision-making.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by countering or removing threats with a mix of counter spells, removal spells, and board wipes. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate card advantage and control the game. The deck also includes cards like Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's hand and Search for Azcanta to help filter through the deck. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the board and outvalue the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage, removal, and disruption. It aims to out-value the opponent by using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset, along with spells like Thought Erasure and Kaya's Wrath to control the board and limit the opponent's options. The deck includes a mix of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw to ensure it can deal with a variety of threats while maintaining a strong presence on the battlefield. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors while still allowing for consistent, on-curve plays.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with removal spells like Kaya's Wrath and Vraska's Contempt. With efficient card draw and disruption spells like Thought Erasure and Duress, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own resources and ultimately taking over the game with powerful threats and card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's Esper colors and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

The main concept of this Esper Aggro deck is to leverage powerful Planeswalker cards like Sorin, Vengeful Bloodlord and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to control the game, while deploying aggressive threats like Thief of Sanity and Hero of Precinct One to pressure the opponent. Thought Erasure and Dovin's Veto provide disruption and protection, while removal spells like Mortify and Tyrant's Scorn help maintain board presence. The strategy focuses on maintaining a balance between controlling the opponent's resources and applying pressure to secure the win.

This deck focuses on creating a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a mix of creature threats and disruption spells. By playing efficient threats like Hero of Precinct One and Thief of Sanity, combined with hand disruption from Thought Erasure and removal spells like Tyrant's Scorn and Mortify, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure on the board. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to control the battlefield and generate card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Ugin, the Ineffable and Basilica Bell-Haunt provide additional value and versatility in various matchups.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and pressure the opponent. By efficiently removing threats from the opponent's side of the board with cards like Hostage Taker and Mortify, while also stealing cards from their deck with Thief of Sanity, the deck aims to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Liliana, Dreadhorde General to generate card advantage and close out the game.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost creatures and using burn spells to clear the way for high-power threats like Ghalta, Primal Hunger and Skarrgan Hellkite. It also includes creatures like Biogenic Ooze and Nullhide Ferox for added versatility and resilience. The Gruul Aggro archetype aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and powerful creatures, maintaining pressure throughout the game. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan by ensuring consistent access to both red and green mana sources.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Goblin Chainwhirler and Viashino Pyromancer to control the board and deal direct damage. Chandra, Fire Artisan and Experimental Frenzy provide additional card advantage and late-game reach, while Runaway Steam-Kin and Ghitu Lavarunner help ramp up mana and increase the aggression of the deck. The goal is to apply relentless pressure and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressive early drops like Fanatical Firebrand and Ghitu Lavarunner, along with powerful spells like Lightning Strike and Wizard's Lightning, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Rix Maadi Reveler helps to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, aggressive play to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Fanatical Firebrand, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Goblin Chainwhirler. It utilizes burn spells like Shock, Lightning Strike, and Skewer the Critics to control the board and finish off the opponent. Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy provide card advantage and help maintain pressure. Chandra, Fire Artisan and Runaway Steam-Kin provide additional damage and card advantage to close out the game. With a mana base consisting solely of Mountains, this deck aims to consistently pressure the opponent and finish the game quickly.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing fast and efficient creatures like Fanatical Firebrand, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Goblin Chainwhirler. The deck also includes burn spells like Shock, Lightning Strike, and Wizard's Lightning to clear the way for attacks. Card advantage is gained through cards like Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy. Chandra, Fire Artisan provides additional damage and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of creatures and burn spells to secure a swift victory.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. By efficiently utilizing cheap creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler, in combination with direct damage spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy provides additional resources and card advantage to maintain pressure on the opponent. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and consistent damage output.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board with a combination of removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Assassin's Trophy, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Hydroid Krasis to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to maintain board presence with creatures like Hostage Taker and Jadelight Ranger, while also being able to generate card advantage with cards like Vivien Reid. Additionally, the deck has a solid mana base with a combination of dual lands to ensure consistency in casting its spells.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to use a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board. By efficiently removing threats and countering key spells, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win through card advantage and powerful late-game threats like Liliana, Ugin, and Enter the God-Eternals. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Search for Azcanta, and Opt helps the deck dig through its library to find the necessary answers and maintain a steady stream of resources to stay ahead of the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with small, aggressive creatures known as "Weenies" in Magic: The Gathering. By quickly establishing a board presence with cards such as Legion's Landing and History of Benalia, the deck aims to amass a strong army of creatures and utilize powerful support cards like Gideon Blackblade and Conclave Tribunal to maintain control of the battlefield. The strategy relies on speed and synergy between the cards to put pressure on the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures, taking advantage of white's buff and protection spells to keep them on the battlefield. It aims to put pressure on the opponent early and often, utilizing cards like History of Benalia and Legion's Landing to generate more creatures and pump up the team. The aggressive strategy is supported by efficient creatures like Skymarcher Aspirant and Venerated Loxodon, with removal and protection cards like Conclave Tribunal and Tomik, Distinguished Advokist to maintain board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to flood the board with low-cost, aggressive white creatures known as Weenies to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Cards like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia help to generate more tokens and buff creatures, while cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon provide additional boosts to the team. Gideon Blackblade and Teferi, Time Raveler offer powerful planeswalker support to push through for the win. This deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply constant pressure on the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on swarming the battlefield with low-cost, efficient white creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Cards like Dauntless Bodyguard, Law-Rune Enforcer, and Adanto Vanguard protect your key creatures while Skymarcher Aspirant, Snubhorn Sentry, and Benalish Marshal provide a steady stream of aggression. Venerated Loxodon boosts your board presence and History of Benalia helps generate additional creatures. Gideon Blackblade and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional utility and disruption. Utilize cards like Legion's Landing and Conclave Tribunal to control the board and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures and using cards like History of Benalia and Venerated Loxodon to buff them up. It also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Conclave Tribunal for control and removal options. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of Plains, Glacial Fortress, and Hallowed Fountain. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure to secure a quick victory.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures and pump them up with anthem effects to quickly close out the game. The strategy revolves around establishing early board presence and then leveraging cards like Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal to buff the team and push for lethal damage. The deck includes white aggressive creatures with abilities that synergize well together, ensuring a fast and powerful offensive strategy to dominate the opponent in one-on-one battles.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly flood the board with cheap, aggressive creatures in order to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. By consistently playing low-cost creatures and using cards like Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal to boost their power, the deck aims to maintain pressure and chip away at the opponent's life total efficiently. Support cards like History of Benalia and Conclave Tribunal provide additional value and removal options to keep the pressure on, while Gideon Blackblade serves as a versatile finisher or defensive option.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with cheap aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Using cards like Dauntless Bodyguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Venerated Loxodon, the goal is to build a wide board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like History of Benalia and Benalish Marshal further enhance the strength of the board. Teferi, Time Raveler provides some control and disruption, while Conclave Tribunal offers removal options. The deck aims to win through early aggression and efficient creature synergies.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with early aggressive creatures and efficient cards that support them. By playing a fast-paced game and constantly pressuring your opponent, you aim to win the game before they can set up their own game plan. The deck utilizes creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Leonin Vanguard, and Skymarcher Aspirant to quickly amass a board presence, while cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon boost the power of your creatures. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and tempo advantage, allowing you to maintain momentum and control the battlefield.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with low-cost creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Utilizing cards like Dauntless Bodyguard, Adanto Vanguard, and Skymarcher Aspirant to establish early board presence, followed by cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon to pump up the team. Cards like History of Benalia and Conclave Tribunal provide additional value and removal options. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the game and close out matches before the opponent can stabilize.
